intro: Narthecium alpinum, commonly known as the alpine wintergreen, is a small herbaceous plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Narthecium alpinum thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It is often found in mountainous areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
